title: Finding the Inverse Matrix
text: We must find the inverse of the matrix $$\begin{bmatrix} \frac{-8}{5} & \frac{-4}{5} \\ \frac{-8}{5} & \frac{1}{5} \end{bmatrix}$$, which is $$\begin{bmatrix} \frac{-1}{8} & \frac{-1}{2} \\ -1 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$
speech: We must find the inverse of the matrix  the 2 by 2 matrix row 1 column 1 fraction, negative 8, over 5,  column 2 fraction, negative 4, over 5,  row 2 column 1 fraction, negative 8, over 5,  column 2 1 fifth , which is  the 2 by 2 matrix row 1 column 1 fraction, negative 1, over 8,  column 2 fraction, negative 1, over 2,  row 2 column 1 negative 1, column 2 1

title: Multiplying the constant matrix and the coefficient matrix.
text: Now, we can multiply $$\begin{bmatrix} \frac{2}{5} \\ \frac{7}{10} \end{bmatrix}$$ by $$\begin{bmatrix} \frac{-1}{8} & \frac{-1}{2} \\ -1 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$, giving us $$\begin{bmatrix} \frac{-2}{3} \\ \frac{-11}{6} \end{bmatrix}$$. Our answer is $$(\frac{-2}{3},\frac{-11}{6})$$
